text: So are we set on a polling webapp?

Well, the idea is certainly welcoming and i’d gladly go for it. There could be many alternatives though, i dont know what TA  will demand as his requirements. I could easily propose the “Online assignment submission system” where students login and upload their work for grading, like moodle does.
I have had this TA in a previous class and he rarely seems to know what is going on lol I'm almost certain we can propose anything. Any other ideas? We can propose multiple
At the moment we have an i-clicker style web app / assignment submission system. My argument for i-clicker web app is that the assignment submission is already in use.
Well, here is the question, did the teacher specified that our prj should have rather unique features or can we just reimplement some of the Moodle like functionality?
I had a feeling this is mostly about documentation and the choice is really not a big deal
The professor said that the software we make has to be a tool for the TA
depends for which class
for our class?
Renne Witte
The TA said e learning like moddle and the prof said e-learning rlly means a tool for the TA lol

Because most TA’s for my elec classes wouldnt mind electronic lab submission system. but for no lab soen341, i have no idea what he might need :slightly_smiling_face: except may be for polling which is always a fun tool.
Isn't eas an electronic submission website?
Yeah we are supposed to discuss on Friday with the TA as if he is a client to determine what he would like.
So we can go with a couple of ideas and work it out with him! Polling site would be pretty easy to make tho. Actually so would a electronic submission site lol
Either idea is good!
Ok it could also assemble the evaluation stats on how perceptually useful(1 to 10) every tutorial had been, using same polling system.
yeah I sure this should be enough to start with him :slightly_smiling_face:
Well with a polling system u can also question the class with multiple choice questions.
And see in real time the answer distribution. Giving u insight on how prepared the class is
yeah thats for sure, i experienced that approach in concordia biology classes before.
A polling system would be useful for both the TA and the students so that should fit either of their definition of an e-learning system
yep
How are we going to create a system like that though
Im sure there is a polling API some where and then just front end UI stuff
<https://github.com/strawpoll/strawpoll/wiki/API>

attachments.title: strawpoll/strawpoll
attachments.text: An easy-to-use online poll creation application. <http://strawpoll.me/>

text: There we go
Oh I see
